item.description:
Update: A better link on the map to the area where the parking lot is. Just to the right of the B

Located at Rome Point which is a part of the John H. Chafee Nature Preserve on Boston Neck rd, Rt 1A between Hamilton Allenton Rd and 138 in Wickford, RI.

Wickford is a cute little town - great place for lunch & a little browsing.

The hike is about 3 miles roundtrip and takes you out to the point, where you can usually see harbor seals at low tide.

This is definitely a dog friendly trail.

Low tide will be at 10:55 on 11/29



Update: Directions notes from Sarah: "There is only one parking lot and entrance to the Chaffee Preserve. The CT folks will be coming from RT 138, so they will take Rt 1A north (Boston Neck Road) and the parking lot will be on the right. There is extra parking on Boston Neck Road."

The directions on the link below are correct, even though they may not seem succinct enough.

So here's what we'll do for Sunday - we'll set up a "Dial for Doggie Directions" phone bank for those who may get confused towards the end. Expert navigational advisers (that'll be me ) will be available to guide you if you get disoriented. (Note: Your mileage may vary using DDD. Maybe by more than you expected. )

Write Down My Cell #: 860-227-4027 - and call if need to.



BETTER Directions:
http://maps.google.co...



Weather
Couldn't look any better. Click here for latest hike weather.
item.name: Seal Watching at Rome Point, RI
